essay_questions.description: Describe algorithms in plain English or pseudocode depending on instructions
rules: If asked to describe an algorithm: write in plain English
If asked to write pseudocode: use structured pseudocode similar to seminar slides or Python

example.question: What is the capital of Australia?

mcq_multiple_answers.description: Select all correct choices and nothing else

example.question: Which of these cities are state capitals?

scoring_rules: Each correct choice gives positive marks
Overall mark per question cannot be below 0

example.question: What is the square root of 36?

matching_question.description: For each part, select the correct answer from a drop-down menu

non_examinable_content.definition: Anything marked 'not examinable' in unit materials is excluded from the test

preparation_suggestions: Practice writing pseudocode for each algorithm
Review seminar slides, unit notes, and applied class sheets
Practice solving problems, especially from applied class and supplementary materials
